basic_input_output_options.title: Basic Input/Output Options
basic_input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

fastq.description: A fastq file or directory containing fastq input files or directories of input files.
fastq.help_text: If directories named \"barcode*\" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently. If `.fastq(.gz)` files are found under the `--fastq` directory the sample is assumed to not be multiplexed. In this second case `--samples` should be a simple name rather than a CSV file.

sample.description: A sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a file or directory of .fastq(.gz).

sample_sheet.description: CSV file with columns named `barcode`, `sample_name` and `type`. Permissible if passing a directory containing barcodeXX sub-directories.

sanitize_fastq.description: Use additional heuristics to identify barcodes from file paths.
sanitize_fastq.help_text: Enabling this option will group together files into samples by the presence of strings of the form `barcodeXXX` present in filenames, rather than simply files grouped into directories (as output by MinKNOW and the Guppy basecaller).

ref_genome.description: Path to reference genome sequence [.fa/.fq/.fa.gz/fq.gz]. Required for reference-based workflow

ref_annotation.description: A reference annotation of gff format

direct_rna.description: Set to true for direct RNA sequencing. Omits the pychopper step.

bundle_min_reads.description: Minimum size of bam bundle for parallel processing.

stringtie_opts.description: Extra options for stringtie transcript assembly.

transcript_table_cov_thresh.description: Minimum coverage for a transcript to appear in the report table

denovo.description: Use denovo transcript assembly rather than reference guided

reference_wf_options.title: Options for reference-based workflow
reference_wf_options.description: Parameters that are used solely for the referenc-guided workflow

plot_gffcmp_stats.description: Create a pdf of plots from showing gffcompare results

minimum_mapping_quality.description: filter aligned reads by MAPQ quality.

poly_context.description: Region size at end of reads to apply poly(A) filter.

max_poly_run.description: Max poly(A) region allowed with poly_context-sized end regions.

denovo_wf_options.title: Options for de novo-based workflow
denovo_wf_options.description: Parameters that are used solely for the de novo workflow

batch_size.description: Maximum sequences per input batch (-1 means no limit)

batch_max_seq.description: Maximum sequences per input batch (-1 means no limit)

min_left_cls.description: Minimum cluser size in the left batch

min_shared.description: Minimum number of minimizers shared between read and cluster

mapped_threshold.description: Minimum mapped fraction of read to be included in cluster

aligned_threshold.description: Minimum aligned fraction of read to be included in cluster

min_fraction.description: Minimum fraction of minimizers shared compared to best hit, in order to continue mapping

min_prob_no_hits.description: Minimum probability for i consecutive minimizers to be different between read and representative

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

This workflow identifies RNA isoforms using either cDNA or direct RNA (dRNA) 
Oxford Nanopore reads.

### Preprocesing
cDNA reads are initially preprocessed by [pychopper](https://github.com/epi2me-labs/pychopper) 
for the identification of full-length reads, as well as trimming and orientation correction (This step is omitted for 
 direct RNA reads).

### Reference-aided approach
* Full length reads are mapped to a supplied reference genome using [minimap2](https://github.com/lh3/minimap2)
* Transcripts are assembled by [stringtie](http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/stringtie) 
in long read mode (with or without a guide reference annotation) to generate the GFF annotation.
* The annotation generated by the pipeline is compared to the reference annotation. 
using [gffcompare](http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/stringtie/gffcompare.shtml)

### de novo-based approach (experimental!)
* Sequence clusters are generated using [isONclust2](https://github.com/nanoporetech/isONclust2)
  * If a reference genome is supplied, cluster quality metrics are determined by comparing    
  with clusters generated from a minimap2 alignment.
* A consensus sequence for each cluster is generated using [spoa](https://github.com/rvaser/spoa)
* Three rounds of polishing using racon and minimap2 to give a final polished CDS for each gene.
* Full-length reads are then mapped to these polished CDS.
* Transcripts are assembled by stringtie as for the reference-based approach.
* __Note__: This approach is currently not supported with direct RNA reads.

### Workflow inputs
- Directory containing cDNA/direct RNA reads. Or a directory containing subdirectories each with reads from different samples
  (in fastq/fastq.gz format)
- Reference genome in fasta format (required for reference-based assembly).
- Optional reference annotation in GFF2/3 format.
